10

Ex-mob boss gets 5 1/2 years in prison for extortion

Luigi “Louie” Manocchio, the 84-year-old former boss of the Mafia in New England, was sentenced in federal court for extorting protection payments from strip clubs. (Globe, 12:29 p.m.)

FDA panel backs first pill to block HIV

The first drug shown to prevent HIV infection was endorsed by a panel today, clearing the way for approval in the fight against the virus that causes AIDS. (AP)
  • Health guide What is HIV  |  Info on AIDS

It's still possible to buy a home below $300,000 and there are even several towns and neighborhoods with prices in the $200,000s now. Here are some options.
  • Inside Real Estate Homes, rentals, and more

Jail for mom who served alcohol to teens

A Beverly mother has been sentenced to six months in jail for providing alcohol to her 16-year-old daughter’s friends at a house party in 2010. (Globe, 12:18 p.m.)

Parents question Newton schools
amid child pornography case

Since his arrest in January on child pornography charges, several past incidents with former Newton school teacher David Ettlinger have come to light. (Globe)
  • 4/3: Ettlinger facing federal child porn charges
  • 2/8: New child porn charges for former Newton teacher
  • 1/19: Newton parents discuss teacher's child porn arrest

Report: Small employers offering health insurance plans with higher costs

Small employers are increasingly offering workers health plans requiring them to pay more for treatments and doctor visits, a new report found. (Globe, 9:39 a.m.)

The Celtics can’t underestimate the eighth-seeded Sixers. They need only see the now-eliminated, top-seeded Bulls as evidence of that.

Mitt Romney’s campaign is weighing how forcefully to use his opposition to gay marriage as a way to energize a social conservative GOP base that has long distrusted him.

N.H. lawmakers are pushing incentives for so-called destination hospitals to open along the state’s border.
